results.title: Memory packs
results.brief_description:
This CD-ROM was created with funding by the Commonwealth Government through the Australia council - its arts and funding advisory body, and by the City of Port Philip Cultural Development Fund.
The work is an interactive exhibition of objects that evoke stories or memories. Young people, old people, people from diverse backgrounds, artists, entertainers, the famous, the infamous and the not yet discovered - all were asked to contribute an object of personal significance and a story to accompany it. The CD-ROM has a linked website (www.experimenta.org/gallery/memorypacks/description.html).

results.title: [Ryo Parker]
results.brief_description:
A sailor experiences a huge fire and subsequent sinking of his sailing ship after he hits a large rock. A fish saves him as he nearly drowns. Once on shore, the sailor goes to the shipyards and purchases another ship and sails off into sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Nicolas Bethune]
results.brief_description:
A U.F.O comes down to visit the Murray River Queen, alias “SS Nicolas” and proceeds to put a spell on a passenger who is eerily altered by the experience.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Nick Nolan]
results.brief_description:
An Olympic soccer player dives out of an Australian stamp to score a goal but hits his head on a rock and dies. People weep for him at his funeral.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: Animated Stamp - [Mitchell Gaffney]
results.brief_description: Asked to “make a stamp come to life”. Mitchell has created a vibrant, multicolored traffic flow in a stamp featuring Sydney Harbour Bridge. The price of the stamp rises as the increase of traffic flow occurs across the bridge. Highly Commended. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: Tom Olsson's Cohuna
results.brief_description: Cohuna - When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector in 1952, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting film give us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950’s Victoria. The school recieved their projector, and Olsson’s films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward.

results.title: World without end [exhibition work compliation]
results.brief_description:
“World without end” was an exhibition held in ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, 14 April 2005 - 17 July 2005. See the Exhibition activity record for more information.

Our experience of the world is shaped by the subtle and dramatic forces of nature, the energies and rhythms of cities, and the elastic time of global travel and instant communication networks.

This exhibition reveals how we perceive the world through an endless series of flows and flux: cycles of night and day, constantly changing weather patterns, crossings through natural and urban environments, currents of memory, emotion and reflection.

Descend into the Screen Gallery, a unique exhibition space tunnelling the length of Federation Square, to experience the world through a range of alternate lenses: everyday occurrences and familiar places seem strangely new and newly strange.

results.title: [Mitchell Etherington/Zac Brodrick]
results.brief_description:
An Olympic diver comes to life out of an Australian stamp and receives scores of 10 by two judges.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Luka Tsaktserlis]
results.brief_description:
An aeroplane comes to life out of the Australian stamp, “Australia circling the earth” and proceeds to fly to London.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Kyrsten Monaghan]
results.brief_description:
Blinky Bill emerges from a stamp and decides to leave his house (which he puts up for sale) and goes surfing. Upon his return, he buys a house from a bear!

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
